programme.sub-title: USOPP'S THE STRONGEST? LEAVE ANYTHING NEGATIVE TO HIM

programme.sub-title: THE GENERAL ZOMBIES ARE DOWN IN A FLASH!! OARS FEELS LIKE AN ADVENTURE!!

programme.desc: One Piece
programme.sub-title: BLAZING KNIGHT SANJI!! KICK DOWN THE FAKE WEDDING

programme.sub-title: A CLEAR-CLEAR HISTORY? SANJI'S STOLEN DREAM

programme.sub-title: SAVE ME, HERO!! MY ENEMY IS THE IMMORTAL PRINCESS

programme.sub-title: PERONA IS TERRIFIED!! USOPP AND UNTRUTHFUL SHARE THE SAME "U"

programme.desc: One Piece
programme.sub-title: CHOPPER IS FURIOUS!! HOGBACK'S EVIL MEDICAL PRACTICES

programme.title: Moria's mansion is reduced to ruins as the zombie with Luffy's shadow stalks the Straw Hats! As the walls come tumbling down, Chopper puts the hurt on Hogback, and Nami vanishes right before Sanji's eyes!

programme.sub-title: OARS ROARS! COME OUT, STRAW HAT CREW

programme.title: One by one, the Straw Hats attack Oars, but the monstrous zombie appears too powerful to be defeated. Luffy's got his sights set on Moria, but he'd better hurry if he wants to save his crew!

programme.sub-title: LUFFY IS THE ENEMY! THE ULTIMATE ZOMBIE VS. THE STRAW HAT CREW

programme.sub-title: THE SLOW-SLOW MENACE / "SILVER FOX" FOXY RETURNS

programme.title: Timecop, (1994, Action)
programme.desc: Max Walker, an officer for a security agency that regulates time travel, must fend for his life against a shady politician who's intent on changing the past to control the future.

programme.title: Species, (1995, Sci-Fi Horror)
programme.desc: She's beautiful, seductive, intelligent, and her charms could spell doom for the entire human race! Ben Kingsley, Forrest Whitaker, and Natasha Henstridge star in this adrenaline-charged sci-fi hit.

programme.title: Snowpiercer, (2014, Action)
programme.desc: After a failed global-warming experiment, a post-apocalyptic Ice Age has killed off nearly all life on the planet.

programme.title: A.I. Artificial Intelligence, (2001, Science fiction)
programme.desc: In a future world, humans share aspects of their lives with companion robots called Mechas. But when an advanced prototype robot child named David is programmed to show unconditional love, his human family isn't prepared for the consequences.

programme.title: War of the Worlds, (2005, Action)

programme.title: Annihilation, (2018, Thriller)
programme.desc: A biologist and former solider (Natalie Portman) must lead a mission into a mysterious quarantine zone known as The Shimmer, a beautiful but deadly world of mutated landscapes and creatures that threatens all life on Earth. Also starring Oscar Isaac.

programme.title: Interstellar, (2014, Science fiction)
programme.desc: From director Christopher Nolan (Inception) comes the story of ex-pilot Cooper (Matthew McConaughey), who must leave his family and Earth behind to lead an expedition beyond this galaxy to discover whether mankind has a future among the stars.

programme.title: Night Stage To Galveston, (1952, Western)
programme.desc: Gene Autry and Pat Buttram work for a newspaper publisher, and find evidence of corruption in the Texas State Police. The publisher‚Äôs daughter is kidnapped to prevent the story from being published.

programme.title: John Sturges' The Hallelujah Trail, (1965, Western)

programme.title: Alias Jesse James, (1959, Western)

programme.title: Pardners, (1956, Western)
programme.desc: A rich momma's boy returns west with the son of his murdered father's partner to foil a gang trying to gain control of his family ranch. They accidentally clean up the town.

programme.desc: John Wayne produces, directs and stars in this retelling of the Alamo, a battle in which 185 men joined together against an army of 7,000. Filmed entirely in Texas, "The Alamo" is a visually stunning and historically accurate celebration of courage.

programme.title: El Dorado, (1966, Western)
programme.desc: Robert Mitchum plays to perfection an alcoholic but gutsy sheriff who relentlessly battles the dark side of the wild West, ruthless cattle barons and crooked ‚Äúbusinessmen.‚Äù

programme.title: Five Card Stud, (1968, Western)
programme.desc: After a card shark is caught cheating, he is taken out and lynched by the drunkards he was playing against. Soon afterwards, the men who were in the lynch mob start being murdered, one after another; all by hanging.

programme.title: Young Billy Young, (1969, Western)
programme.desc: In this gun-slinging adventure, an aging lawman (Robert Mitchum) teams up with Young Billy Young (Robert Walker), a fast-draw outlaw on the run. But it‚Äôs an alliance that explodes when the lawman discovers a secret that could rip two towns apart!

programme.title: Baby Boy, (2001, Drama)

programme.title: The Mexican, (2001, Action)

programme.desc: Dr. Helen Magnus fights to save the life of one of the Sanctuarys research scientists who is attacked by a seemingly docile Abnormal; baffled by the creatures behavior, Henry tries to see what, or who, caused the Abnormal to react so violently.

programme.title: Sanctuary
programme.desc: Will goes up against the heads of the Sanctuary Network to defend Magnus who is charged with murder; as the evidence stacks up against her, even Will has trouble finding a way to convincingly defend her innocence.

programme.title: Racetime
programme.desc: After losing a rigged sled race, Frankie challenges newcomer Zac to one last showdown. With the stakes higher than ever, Zac will stop at nothing to win the race. Starring Lucinda Davis, Noel Fisher, Angela Galuppo.

programme.title: Air Bud: Seventh Inning Fetch
programme.desc: The golden retriever joins a middle-school baseball team and searches for his missing offspring. Starring Kevin Zegers, Caitlin Wachs, Cynthia Stevenson.

programme.title: The Vow
programme.desc: After his newlywed wife awakes from a coma, a man works to restore her lost memory and rebuild their marriage. Starring Rachel McAdams, Channing Tatum, Sam Neill.

programme.title: Kalinga (Care)
programme.desc: The stories of several Filipina caregivers and nannies in Vancouver, that bear witness to their sacrifices as they struggle to reunite with their children and families.

programme.title: Miltons Secret
programme.desc: A man (Donald Sutherland) teaches his 11-year-old grandson (William Ainscough) how to cope with bickering parents and the neighborhood bully. Starring Donald Sutherland, Michelle Rodriguez, Mia Kirshner.

programme.title: The Maze Runner
programme.desc: A teen awakes within a massive maze with other teens, with no memory of his past other than dreams about an organization known as WCKD. He hopes to escape by piecing together fragments of his past and clues he discovers in the labyrinth. Starring Dylan OBrien, Kaya Scodelario, Aml Ameen.

programme.title: Maze Runner: The Scorch Trials
programme.desc: Thomas and his fellow teenage Gladers battle the powerful organization WCKD while facing the perils of the Scorch, a desolate landscape filled with dangerous obstacles and crawling with the virus-infected Cranks. Starring Dylan OBrien, Kaya Scodelario, Giancarlo Esposito.

programme.title: Maze Runner: The Death Cure
programme.desc: Thomas leads some escaped Gladers on their final and most dangerous mission yet. To save their friends, they must break into the legendary Last City, a WCKD-controlled labyrinth that may turn out to be the deadliest maze of all. Starring Dylan OBrien, Thomas Brodie-Sangster, Kaya Scodelario.

programme.title: The BMF Documentary: Blowing Money Fast
programme.desc: As law enforcement tightens their grip, a wiretap on Terry Flenorys phone provides a critical breakthrough; the divide between the brothers grows, eventually splitting BMF into two separate divisions.

programme.title: Freddy vs. Jason
programme.desc: Teens are caught in the middle of a battle between the razor-clawed Freddy and the masked killer Jason. Starring Robert Englund, Ken Kirzinger, Monica Keena.

programme.title: Friday the 13th
programme.desc: While searching for his missing sister, a young man (Jared Padalecki) and a group of student revelers encounter a hockey-masked killer and his razor-sharp machete at the ruins of Camp Crystal Lake. Starring Jared Padalecki, Danielle Panabaker, Amanda Righetti.

programme.title: William Shakespeares Romeo and Juliet
programme.desc: Twentieth-century teenagers (Leonardo DiCaprio, Claire Danes) fall in love, despite feuding families, in an update of the classic tragedy. Starring Leonardo DiCaprio, Claire Danes, Brian Dennehy.

programme.title: Bros
programme.desc: Repeatedly drawn to each other, two commitment-phobic men begin to show their vulnerable sides as their undeniable attraction turns into something resembling a relationship. Starring Billy Eichner, Luke Macfarlane, Guy Branum.

programme.title: Kalinga (Care)
programme.desc: The stories of several Filipina caregivers and nannies in Vancouver, that bear witness to their sacrifices as they struggle to reunite with their children and families.

programme.title: Paco
programme.desc: Paco is a Filipino immigrant living in Canada, trying to make ends meet so he can make a better life for his family in Manila. Starring Edward Escobal, Jason Asuncion, Khia Arkysha Donguines.

programme.title: Breakaway
programme.desc: A young man is torn between his traditional Indo-Canadian family expectations and his dreams of playing hockey. Starring Russell Peters, Rob Lowe, Camilla Belle.

programme.title: Ever After: A Cinderella Story
programme.desc: Treated as a servant by her stepmother (Anjelica Huston), a 16th-century woman (Drew Barrymore) wins the heart of the French prince (Dougray Scott). Starring Drew Barrymore, Anjelica Huston, Dougray Scott.

programme.title: A Knights Tale
programme.desc: An English commoner (Heath Ledger) dons the armor of a dead jouster and, with the help of friends (Mark Addy, Paul Bettany, Alan Tudyk), competes against nobles in 14th-century France. Starring Heath Ledger, Mark Addy, Rufus Sewell.

programme.title: The Princess Bride
programme.desc: A storybook stableboy turns pirate (Cary Elwes) and rescues his beloved (Robin Wright), who is about to marry a dreadful prince. Starring Cary Elwes, Robin Wright, Mandy Patinkin.

programme.title: My Big Fat Greek Wedding
programme.desc: Family tensions arise after a woman (Nia Vardalos) falls in love with a man (John Corbett) who is not Greek. Starring Nia Vardalos, John Corbett, Michael Constantine.

programme.title: The Age of Adaline
programme.desc: A woman who has miraculously remained young for nearly 80 years meets a charismatic philanthropist who reawakens her passion for life and romance. Starring Blake Lively, Michiel Huisman, Kathy Baker.

programme.title: Maid in Manhattan
programme.desc: A senatorial candidate (Ralph Fiennes) falls for a chambermaid (Jennifer Lopez) after he mistakes her for a guest (Natasha Richardson) at the hotel. Starring Jennifer Lopez, Ralph Fiennes, Natasha Richardson.

programme.title: Moonstruck
programme.desc: An Italian-American widow (Cher), engaged to a reticent suitor, falls in love with his brother (Nicolas Cage). Starring Cher, Nicolas Cage, Vincent Gardenia.

programme.title: Mob Cops
programme.desc: When a retired NYPD detective writes a book about his familys ties to the mob, it ignites a firestorm between dirty cops working for a brutal crime boss and the officers trying to bring them to justice. Starring David Arquette, Jeremy Luke, Danny A. Abeckaser.

programme.title: Sicario
programme.desc: Recruited by Matt Graver, FBI agent Kate Macer joins a task force for the escalating war against drugs. Led by the intense Alejandro, the team travels back-and-forth across the U.S.-Mexican border, using one cartel boss to flush out a bigger one. Starring Emily Blunt, Benicio del Toro, Josh Brolin.

programme.title: Run This Town
programme.desc: A journalist and a political aide become entangled in a larger-than-life scandal. Starring Ben Platt, Mena Massoud, Nina Dobrev.

programme.title: Spider
programme.desc: Haunted by his childhood, a psychotic loner (Ralph Fiennes) has difficulty after his release from a mental institution. Starring Ralph Fiennes, Miranda Richardson, Gabriel Byrne.

programme.title: Get Yourself a College Girl
programme.desc: A young music student faces expulsion after her instructors learn she is moonlighting as a pop-music writer. Starring The Dave Clark Five, The Animals, Mary Ann Mobley.

programme.title: Lonely Are the Brave
programme.desc: A modern-day New Mexico sheriff reluctantly pursues a cowboy whose individualistic ways are out of sync with the times. Starring Kirk Douglas, Gena Rowlands, Walter Matthau.

programme.title: Charley Varrick
programme.desc: The police and a hit man (Joe Don Baker) chase a petty thief (Walter Matthau) and his partner for robbing a mob bank. Starring Walter Matthau, Joe Don Baker, Felicia Farr.

programme.title: The Voice in the Mirror
programme.desc: An alcoholic artist finds the strength he needs to stay on the wagon with the help of a fellow alcoholic. Starring Richard Egan, Julie London, Arthur OConnell.

programme.title: The Sunshine Boys
programme.desc: After a long separation, two former vaudeville partners reunite to renew their friendship and their feud. Starring Walter Matthau, George Burns, Richard Benjamin.

programme.title: Ensign Pulver
programme.desc: Would-be doctor Pulver (Robert Walker) ends up in a life raft with the World War II Navy captain (Burl Ives) he hates. Starring Robert Walker, Burl Ives, Walter Matthau.

programme.title: The Yellow Canary
programme.desc: During World War II, a double agent from Britain exposes a Nazi plot to blow up a shipping port in Nova Scotia. Starring Anna Neagle, Richard Greene, Nova Pilbeam.

programme.title: Blithe Spirit
programme.desc: The ghost (Kay Hammond) of a novelists (Rex Harrison) first wife visits him and his second wife (Constance Cummings). Starring Rex Harrison, Constance Cummings, Kay Hammond.

programme.title: The Importance of Being Earnest
programme.desc: Victorian Jack Worthing (Michael Redgrave), found in a handbag, seeks the hand of Lady Bracknells (Edith Evans) daughter. Starring Michael Redgrave, Michael Denison, Edith Evans.

programme.title: The Runaway Bus
programme.desc: Inept bus driver Percy Lamb (Frankie Howerd) has the task of driving stranded passengers to an unaffected airport when fog closes Heathrow. Starring Frankie Howerd, Margaret Rutherford, Petula Clark.

programme.title: Just My Luck
programme.desc: A mild-mannered jewelers assistant (Norman Wisdom) gets in over his head when he spends a day at the races. Starring Norman Wisdom, Margaret Rutherford, Jill Dixon.

programme.title: The V.I.P.s
programme.desc: Very important people (Elizabeth Taylor, Richard Burton, Louis Jourdan) must wait in a London airport. Starring Elizabeth Taylor, Richard Burton, Louis Jourdan.

programme.title: Murder, She Said
programme.desc: Agatha Christies sleuth Miss Marple (Margaret Rutherford) gets a job at an estate where she thinks theres a corpse. Starring Margaret Rutherford, Arthur Kennedy, Muriel Pavlow.

programme.title: Murder Most Foul
programme.desc: Agatha Christies tweedy sleuth Miss Marple (Margaret Rutherford) is a juror with a hunch about a murder trial. Starring Margaret Rutherford, Ron Moody, Bud Tingwell.

programme.title: Doctor Zhivago
programme.desc: The Russian Revolution forms the backdrop for this tale of a sensitive Russian physician (Omar Sharif) who is torn between his loyal, long-suffering wife (Geraldine Chaplin) and the great love (Julie Christie) of his life. Starring Omar Sharif, Julie Christie, Geraldine Chaplin.

programme.title: Wuthering Heights
programme.desc: Emily Bront√´s gothic heroine Cathy (Merle Oberon) loves stableboy Heathcliff (Laurence Olivier) but marries squire Edgar (David Niven). Starring Merle Oberon, Laurence Olivier, David Niven.

programme.title: Cyrano de Bergerac
programme.desc: Long-nosed Cyrano (Jose Ferrer) loves fair Roxane (Mala Powers) but woos her with verse for a tongue-tied friend (William Prince). Starring Jose Ferrer, Mala Powers, William Prince.

programme.title: Splendor in the Grass
programme.desc: In 1925 Kansas, a teenage girl suffers an emotional breakdown following a platonic love affair. Beattys film debut. Starring Natalie Wood, Warren Beatty, Pat Hingle.

programme.title: Cabin in the Sky
programme.desc: Agents of heaven and hell fight for Little Joes (Eddie "Rochester" Anderson) soul after his wife (Ethel Waters) gets him a pardon. Starring Ethel Waters, Eddie "Rochester" Anderson, Lena Horne.

programme.title: The Wonderful World of the Brothers Grimm
programme.desc: The German brothers (Laurence Harvey, Karl Boehm) story bridges fairy tales: "The Dancing Princess," "The Cobbler and the Elves," "The Singing Bone." Starring Laurence Harvey, Karlheinz Bohm, Claire Bloom.

programme.title: The Thief of Bagdad
programme.desc: A boy thief (Sabu) and a genie in a bottle help a blinded prince (John Justin) recover his kingdom from a grand vizier (Conrad Veidt). Starring Sabu, John Justin, Conrad Veidt.

programme.title: Juliet of the Spirits
programme.desc: Federico Fellinis surrealistic account of a housewife who is told by a psychic that her husband has been unfaithful. Starring Giulietta Masina, Sandra Milo, Sylva Koscina.

programme.title: Lili
programme.desc: A French teen (Leslie Caron) joins a carnival and meets a lying magician (Jean-Pierre Aumont) and a loving puppeteer (Mel Ferrer). Starring Leslie Caron, Mel Ferrer, Jean-Pierre Aumont.

programme.title: 7 Faces of Dr. Lao
programme.desc: A Chinese showman (Tony Randall) becomes Merlin, Pan, Medusa, Apollonius, the Abominable Snowman and a sea serpent. Starring Tony Randall, Barbara Eden, Arthur OConnell.

programme.title: Brigadoon
programme.desc: New Yorkers (Gene Kelly, Van Johnson) hunting in the Scottish Highlands find a magic village that fell asleep in 1754. Starring Gene Kelly, Van Johnson, Cyd Charisse.

programme.title: Father of the Bride
programme.desc: A father grapples with financial and emotional challenges as his daughter marries. He learns about love and letting go while planning the wedding. Starring Spencer Tracy, Elizabeth Taylor, Joan Bennett.

programme.title: Four Weddings and a Funeral
programme.desc: An English charmer (Hugh Grant) and a lusty American (Andie MacDowell) make love over a course of surprising events. Starring Hugh Grant, Andie MacDowell, Kristin Scott Thomas.

programme.title: The Graduate
programme.desc: An aimless college man (Dustin Hoffman) lets an older woman (Anne Bancroft) seduce him, then finds himself falling for her daughter (Katharine Ross). Starring Dustin Hoffman, Anne Bancroft, Katharine Ross.

programme.title: High Society
programme.desc: A socialites (Grace Kelly) ex-husband (Bing Crosby) and a magazine writer (Frank Sinatra) show up for her wedding and cause havoc. Starring Bing Crosby, Grace Kelly, Frank Sinatra.

programme.title: Smilin Through
programme.desc: A Victorian Englishmans (Leslie Howard) niece (Norma Shearer) and her suitor (Fredric March) resemble his long-dead bride and tragic rival. Starring Norma Shearer, Leslie Howard, Fredric March.

programme.title: Roberta
programme.desc: An American jazzman (Fred Astaire) and his buddy woo a Russian princess (Irene Dunne) and a fake countess (Ginger Rogers) in Paris. Starring Irene Dunne, Fred Astaire, Ginger Rogers.

programme.title: The Hunchback of Notre Dame
programme.desc: Grotesque bell-ringer Quasimodo (Charles Laughton) saves Gypsy Esmeralda (Maureen OHara) from a mob and a corrupt priest (Sir Cedric Hardwicke) in medieval Paris. Starring Charles Laughton, Maureen OHara, Cedric Hardwicke.

programme.title: Ninotchka
programme.desc: A playboy (Melvyn Douglas) charms a Russian envoy (Greta Garbo) sent to fetch three wayward comrades in Paris. Starring Greta Garbo, Melvyn Douglas, Ina Claire.

programme.title: Casablanca
programme.desc: A cynical nightclub owner in Casablanca protects an old flame and her husband from Nazis, while also trying to navigate his complicated past. Starring Humphrey Bogart, Ingrid Bergman, Paul Henreid.

programme.title: Made in Paris
programme.desc: A fashion buyer (Ann-Margret) sent to Paris attracts a charmer (Louis Jourdan), a newsman (Richard Crenna) and her boss son. Starring Ann-Margret, Louis Jourdan, Richard Crenna.

programme.title: Camille
programme.desc: Marguerite is a well-kept courtesan of the rich and influential Baron de Varville, but when a promising young man falls in love with her, his sincere adoration causes her to question her comfortable life. Starring Greta Garbo, Robert Taylor, Lionel Barrymore.

programme.title: Charade
programme.desc: A suave stranger (Cary Grant) helps a chic widow (Audrey Hepburn) stalked by four men looking for loot in Paris. Starring Cary Grant, Audrey Hepburn, Walter Matthau.

programme.title: An American in Paris
programme.desc: An American soldier (Gene Kelly) stays in Paris after World War II to paint and falls in love with a French beauty (Leslie Caron). Starring Gene Kelly, Leslie Caron, Oscar Levant.

programme.title: Moulin Rouge
programme.desc: In the 1890s France a courtesan falls in love with a young writer but strings along a duke who can finance improvements to the night spot. Starring Nicole Kidman, Ewan McGregor, John Leguizamo.

programme.title: Jack of Diamonds
programme.desc: A cat burglar (George Hamilton) replaces his mentor (Joseph Cotten) and joins a woman (Marie Laforet) and her stepfather on a necklace caper in Paris. Starring George Hamilton, Joseph Cotten, Marie Laforet.

programme.title: Irma La Douce
programme.desc: A fired French policeman (Jack Lemmon) falls for a Paris streetwalker (Shirley MacLaine) and becomes her protector. Starring Shirley MacLaine, Jack Lemmon, Lou Jacobi.

programme.title: The Nature of Things
programme.sub-title: Equus: The Story of the Horse - Chasing the Wind
programme.desc: The wild horse has been saved from extinction, resulting in over 400 breeds.

programme.desc: Canadian Inuk throat singer, songwriter, novelist and visual artist Tanya Tagaq speaks about matters that are important to her, including the seal hunt, the forced relocation of her family and how her parents shaped her.

programme.desc: Cut from his NFL football team, a man starts bonding with his young daughter (Skai Jackson) and encourages her to play soccer.

programme.desc: The fates of three families become inextricably intertwined when a Palestinian citizen is killed by a Jewish settler in the city of Lod, Israel, and deadly riots break out.

programme.title: The Last Stop in Yuma County (2023)
programme.sub-title: The Last Stop in Yuma County (2023)
programme.desc: Stranded at an Arizona rest stop, a traveling knife salesman gets thrust into a high-stakes hostage situation by the arrival of two bank robbers who will stop at nothing to protect their ill-begotten fortune.

programme.title: The Outlaws (2024)
programme.desc: A group of outlaws awaken to their empty train heist bag. Interrogations begin as each cowboy becomes the focus in an attempt to unmask the thief among them. Tensions mount as each bandit struggles to clear their name before bullets fly.

programme.title: Love and Monsters (2020)
programme.desc: A young man and his traveling companions battle an array of monsters during an 80-mile journey to find the woman he loves.

programme.title: Extra Ordinary (2019)
programme.desc: A woman who has supernatural abilities must save a possessed girl.

programme.title: Switchback (1997)
programme.desc: A college student (Jared Leto) and a former rail worker (Danny Glover) are suspects in an FBI agents (Dennis Quaid) hunt for a serial killer who abducted his son.

programme.title: The Sum of All Fears (2002)
programme.desc: Jack Ryan (Ben Affleck) and the CIA director (Morgan Freeman) try to stop terrorists who are planning a nuclear attack.

programme.title: The Contractor (2022)
programme.desc: When his new assignment goes awry, an elite soldier finds himself hunted and on the run, caught in a dangerous conspiracy and fighting to stay alive long enough to get home and uncover the true motives of those who betrayed him.

programme.title: The Foreigner (2017)
programme.desc: A businessman embarks on a revenge-fueled vendetta after his daughter dies in a terrorist bombing. His search leads to a cat-and-mouse conflict with a British government official whose past may hold the clues to the identities of the elusive killers.

programme.title: American Assassin (2017)
programme.desc: Cold War veteran Stan Hurley takes CIA black ops recruit Mitch Rapp under his wing, and they join forces with a lethal Turkish agent to stop a mysterious operative who wants to start a global war.

programme.title: Norbit (2007)
programme.desc: Though married to a terrible shrew, a man (Eddie Murphy) tries to figure out a way to be with his childhood sweetheart (Thandie Newton), who has just moved back into town.

programme.title: College (2008)
programme.desc: Three high-school seniors (Drake Bell, Andrew Caldwell, Kevin Covais) spend a wild weekend with members of Fairmont Universitys rowdiest fraternity.

programme.title: From Dusk Till Dawn (1996)
programme.desc: Desperado brothers (George Clooney, Quentin Tarantino) kidnap a preacher (Harvey Keitel) and his kids, commandeer their RV and wind up in a Mexican strip joint where vampires lurk.

programme.title: Star Trek: First Contact (1996)
programme.desc: Picard (Patrick Stewart), Riker (Jonathan Frakes) and the others set off to stop the half-robot Borg from sabotaging the first warp drive flight in 2063.

programme.title: We Were Soldiers (2002)
programme.desc: A lieutenant colonel and approximately 400 U.S. troops battle 2,000 North Vietnamese soldiers in 1965.

programme.title: The Firm (1993)
programme.desc: A law-school grad uncovers a sinister secret about the Tennessee firm that made him an offer he couldnt refuse.

programme.title: Due Justice (2023)
programme.desc: Consumed by grief and driven by revenge, a former Marine embarks on a relentless mission to hunt down those responsible for the brutal murders of his beloved wife and daughter.

programme.title: Barrons Cove (2024)
programme.desc: A man with a violent past kidnaps the boy he holds responsible for his sons death. As he grows closer to uncovering the truth, hes left to wonder whether his pursuers are really seeking to protect the boy, or merely the secrets he keeps.

programme.title: Witness (1985)
programme.desc: An eight-year-old Amish boy witnesses a drug-related murder in a Philadelphia train station. The Philadelphia police captain discovers that the murderers are cops trying to squelch a corruption investigation.

programme.title: The Saint (1997)
programme.desc: A clever thief who is known as the master of creating false identities using the names of Catholic saints, is hired by the Russian Mafia for his next mission. But things get complicated when he falls for Emma Russel, the scientist.

programme.title: Scream (1996)
programme.desc: A psycho killer targets a past victims daughter (Neve Campbell), while a tabloid TV reporter (Courteney Cox) homes in on his identity.

programme.title: Scream 2 (1997)
programme.desc: A masked killer continues to pursue a California student (Neve Campbell) and her friends at an Ohio college.

programme.title: Scream 3 (2000)
programme.desc: Murders draw a young woman (Neve Campbell), a reporter (Courteney Cox Arquette) and an ex-policeman (David Arquette) to the set of a movie inspired by horrific events that they survived.

programme.title: The Crow (1994)
programme.desc: A black bird resurrects a rock musician who then avenges his own murder and his fiancees.

programme.title: The Crow: City of Angels (1996)
programme.desc: A magic black crow guides a motorcycle mechanic (Vincent Perez) who returns to avenge the murders of himself and his son.

programme.title: Star Trek V: The Final Frontier (1989)
programme.sub-title: Star Trek V: The Final Frontier (1989)
programme.desc: A renegade Vulcan makes Kirk (William Shatner), Spock (Leonard Nimoy), McCoy (DeForest Kelley) and the Enterprise go to a planet at the center of the galaxy.

programme.title: Kindred (2025)
programme.desc: A pair of twisted, young criminals decide to break into a mansion for one big score, but they soon find out that the owners of the house are much more dangerous than they are.

programme.title: Cop Land (1997)
programme.desc: The sheriff (Sylvester Stallone) of a small New Jersey police community confronts key men (Harvey Keitel, Ray Liotta) on both sides of a law-enforcement cover-up.

programme.title: Old Guy (2024)
programme.desc: An aging hit man must train a young prodigy when his employer moves to replace the old guard. However, when they learn theyre being betrayed, the unlikely pair turns into a lethal team -- with their double-crossing bosses in their sights.

programme.title: The Score (2001)
programme.desc: A master thief (Robert De Niro) agrees to work with a volatile partner (Edward Norton) for one last heist before he retires.

programme.title: Gangs of New York (2002)
programme.desc: During the era of Tammany Halls sway, a young man (Leonardo DiCaprio) vows vengeance on the vicious gangster (Daniel Day-Lewis) who killed his father.

programme.title: Sweeney Todd: The Demon Barber of Fleet Street (2007)
programme.sub-title: Sweeney Todd: The Demon Barber of Fleet Street (2007)
programme.desc: After serving time for a crime he did not commit, a vengeful barber (Johnny Depp) and his accomplice (Helena Bonham Carter) carve up unlucky customers and bake them in meat pies.

programme.title: Sound of Violence (2021)
programme.desc: A young killer experiences intense pleasure whenever she hears the sound of human pain.

programme.title: The Virgin Suicides (1999)
programme.desc: Men reminisce about intriguing sisters, whose parents (James Woods, Kathleen Turner) quarantined them after one of the five killed herself.

programme.title: Our Friend (2019)
programme.desc: After Nicole and Matthew receive life-altering news, the couple find unexpected support from their friend Dane, who puts his own life on hold to move into their family home.

programme.title: Alfie (2004)
programme.desc: A Londoner (Jude Law) continues his womanizing ways while working as a chauffeur in New York.

programme.title: Bridget Joness Baby (2016)
programme.desc: Befuddled mom-to-be Bridget Jones (Renee Zellweger) must figure out which of the two men (Colin Firth, Patrick Dempsey) in her life is the father of her child.

programme.title: A Single Man (2009)
programme.desc: Planning to commit suicide at the end of the day, a gay professor (Colin Firth) who recently lost his lover goes about his daily routine and visits with longtime friends.

programme.title: The Violent Heart (2020)
programme.desc: Long-buried secrets threaten to tear a couple apart.

programme.title: End of Sentence (2019)
programme.desc: After being released from prison, a young man reluctantly embarks on a journey with his estranged father to spread his mothers ashes in her native Ireland.

programme.title: Dead Man Walking (1995)
programme.desc: A nun helps a double murderer deal with his actions and prepare for his execution in a New Orleans prison.

programme.title: The House of Yes (1997)
programme.desc: A man (Josh Hamilton) and his fiancee (Tori Spelling) visit his warped clan, complete with dark mansion and incestuous twin sister (Parker Posey).

programme.title: Nobodys Fool (2018)
programme.desc: Wild child Tanya looks to her buttoned-up, by-the-book sister Danica to help her get back on her feet. As these polar opposites collide, Tanya soon discovers that Danicas picture-perfect life and boyfriend may not be what they seem.

programme.title: The First Wives Club (1996)
programme.desc: Three 50-ish college friends (Goldie Hawn, Bette Midler, Diane Keaton) plot revenge after their husbands dump them for younger women.

programme.title: Shes All That (1999)
programme.desc: A cool teen (Freddie Prinze Jr.) bets a friend that he can transform the schools geekiest girl (Rachael Leigh Cook) into a prom queen.

programme.title: Win a Date With Tad Hamilton! (2004)
programme.sub-title: Win a Date With Tad Hamilton! (2004)
programme.desc: Secretly in love with his friend (Kate Bosworth), a supermarket manager (Topher Grace) becomes jealous when she meets a famous actor (Josh Duhamel).

programme.title: The To Do List (2013)
programme.desc: Determined to shed her uptight image, a high-school valedictorian (Aubrey Plaza) decides to lose her virginity before college begins. Realizing that she is out of her depth, she asks friends and family for advice.

programme.title: Last Weekend (2014)
programme.desc: Petty squabbling marks the Memorial Day reunion of an affluent matriarch (Patricia Clarkson) and her dysfunctional family (Chris Mulkey, Zachary Booth).

programme.title: Boudica: Queen of War (2023)
programme.desc: Roman conquerors slay King Prasutagus, take away his children, and force his wife, Boudica, into subservience. Consumed by grief and a burning desire for justice, Boudica vows to reclaim her homeland from the clutches of the Romans.

programme.title: All the World Is Sleeping (2021)
programme.desc: A young mother in New Mexico sinks deeper into addiction while struggling to care for her daughter.

programme.title: Dead Man Walking (1995)
programme.desc: A nun helps a double murderer deal with his actions and prepare for his execution in a New Orleans prison.

programme.title: Seaside (2018)
programme.desc: A woman decides to run away to the Oregon coast with her boyfriend when he inherits a family beach house.

programme.title: I Love You, I Love You Not (1997)
programme.sub-title: I Love You, I Love You Not (1997)
programme.desc: A Jewish prep school student (Claire Danes) shares stories of anti-Semitism with her grandmother (Jeanne Moreau), an Auschwitz survivor.

programme.title: Blue Eyed Girl (2025)
programme.desc: Summoned home to visit her two sisters and her ailing father, a woman starts to re-evaluate her life as she wonders what could have been.

programme.title: The Romantics (2010)
programme.desc: Longtime rivalries resurface in the hours before a woman is scheduled to marry the former lover of her college roommate.

programme.title: Jane Eyre (1996)
programme.desc: Charlotte Bront√´s gothic heroine loves her moody employer, who keeps a dark secret hidden from her.

programme.title: Shakespeare in Love (1998)
programme.desc: Young William Shakespeare (Joseph Fiennes) falls for Viola (Gwyneth Paltrow), reawakening his creativity, but she is betrothed to Wessex.

programme.title: Queen of the Desert (2015)
programme.desc: Gertrude Bells life as an explorer, cartographer, and archaeologist for the British Empire.

programme.title: Cold Mountain (2003)
programme.desc: During the Civil War, a wounded Confederate soldier (Jude Law) abandons his duties to make his way home to his sweetheart (Nicole Kidman).

programme.title: The Stepford Wives (2004)
programme.desc: A man and his wife move to a quaint suburb where most of the women seem to have the same bland personality.

programme.title: Persona (2024)
programme.desc: Two injured women find themselves trapped inside a secluded home with no memory of how they got there. Scared, confused, and distrustful of each other, they must figure out a way to escape before their captor comes back for them.

programme.title: I Used to Go Here (2020)
programme.desc: A successful author finds herself deeply enmeshed in the lives of a group of college students after being asked to speak at her alma mater.

programme.title: The Words (2012)
programme.desc: An aspiring writer pays a heavy price after he finds another mans long-lost manuscript and passes it off as his own.

programme.title: Personal Shopper (2016)
programme.desc: A young American in Paris works as a personal shopper for a celebrity. She seems to have the ability to communicate with spirits, like her recently deceased twin brother. Soon, she starts to receive ambiguous messages from an unknown source.

programme.title: Becoming Jane (2007)
programme.desc: Though her parents expect her to marry a wealthy suitor, young Jane Austen (Anne Hathaway) becomes involved with a penniless lawyer (James McAvoy) who inspires her future writings.

programme.title: Miles to Go Before I Sleep
programme.desc: The relationships between musicians and their road crews and the importance of the people who work to put shows together.

programme.title: Pretty Red Dress (2022)
programme.desc: The story of Travis, Candice and their daughter, Kenisha, and their relationships with the same red dress.

programme.title: The Virgin Suicides (1999)
programme.desc: Men reminisce about intriguing sisters, whose parents (James Woods, Kathleen Turner) quarantined them after one of the five killed herself.

programme.title: Superstar (1999)
programme.desc: An energetic schoolgirl (Molly Shannon) hopes to win a talent contest where a prize as a movie extra might lead to her first kiss.

programme.title: Down to You (2000)
programme.desc: Two collegians (Freddie Prinze Jr., Julia Stiles) fall in love but have a bumpy affair due to mischievous roommates and the temptation to stray.

programme.title: Sixteen Candles (1984)
programme.desc: A girl turning 16 likes another girls guy (Michael Schoeffling) and feels nobody cares about her birthday.
